Then he rests his head on Ron’s chest. He stays there a moment. His voice is a soft cracked whis when he tries to sing more of the Pretenders song, “it’s my place, to know what you feel, I’d like to know, but wh should I?” Richard stands, walks out.
Jonathan looks up with glazed eyes at Richard.

He awake? Richard slowly shakes his head “no.” Jonathan and Richard stare at each other for a long beat. Jonathan’s eyes find the fingernail cuts on Richard’s forearms. Jonathan seems to sense what has happened.

Jonathan and Richard stand by a mound of dirt next to Tim grave. Richard lights a torch with a match and a huge bal of fire forces them back. The camera slowly pushes through the fire and Richard put his arm around Jonathan, leans in close and whispers in t flickering orange light.
He has better things in store, beyond anything you could think or ask. (MORE )

The dying is a sheer kindness to the black soul. Not a light. But a step by shallow step, welcome our menace and shadow. Listen to me, the beginning of the end is quiet and velvet. This is the perfect failure. And the two friends lean on each other, knowing.

Three-hundred feet above the sea. We see Boyde emerge fro small sheriff's office. She takes in the view as walks toward a picnic table. A FEW MINUTES LATER... Boyde sits with her sister, KATIE. Nearby, Katie’s two BO STEVIE (7) and MATT (4) play on the grass.
It’s funny isn’t it? How you can’t predict what anyone is going to end up like.
Well, you can, kind of, I mean, Stevie’s like his dad, mechanical. And Matt’s just creative as anything.
I know he is. I still have the drawing of the rabbit he did up in my office. He’s a bit of a charmer too. They look at Matt. He’s lost in the sensation of running blade of grass over his nose.
I’m glad I never had children. Katie turns to her, tries to guess what she means by this
You're afraid you'd be a bad mother.  92.
No, no. All the worry, all the fear you must have. Everything is so random.
It’s a trade off. (then) You don’t get love without fear.
(nodding) True. A beat while they watch the boys.
Where are the men, Katie? Katie’s eyes widen, this is not the kind of question she’ used to from her sister.
Well if Jeff's any measure, I scare mine away. If that’s what you mean.
You didn’t scare him away. All three of you did. The family.
I don’t know if I ever expected more, maybe that’s the problem.
I didn’t mean that anyway. I meant why do they run, and shut us out. (then) And then say we’re skittish. Katie turns to her.
(gently) Don’t look at me like that. I don’t hate men, I love them. (then) It’s just that they expect you to be there and then they dissolve right in front of you.
They disappear.  108 109 93. Matt turns toward Boyde, stares at her.
You'd think there would be a lot more people in love than there are. Matt makes his way to her, a sweet smile on his face. He holds out his hand, says one simple word.
Play. And takes her hand. She stands, smiles back at Katie as M pulls her out on the grass.
Told you he was a charmer.
Blows past us...

Local bar. Loaded with locals. Juke Box plays. Jonathan and Richard watch TWO LOCAL GUYS (30'S) play pool. They wait to play the winner. Richard holds a large glass beer. It slips from his fingers and explodes on the floor Player #1 looks up from his shot.

Can’t handle your beer, huh faggot? Player #1 goes back to his shot, buries it. Richard sees six inch wide cigarette-burned wood shelf running the len of the wall beneath the sign-up chalkboard. There are two beers on it. Richard casually walks over and drains one.
Hey. Hey! Then he drains the other one.
Those were our beers, asshole.
You made unnecessary commentary regarding my misfortune as well as a gay slur. So I drank your beers. We're even.  94.
Who the fuck are you?
How could that possibly matter?
(warning) Richard...
You’re gonna buy us two beers. Or buy yourself a taxi to the hospital.
I’m not buying you anything, and my friend here is a physician so I can get treatment right here if I require it.
You just barked up the wrong tree asshole because I’m your worst fucking nightmare.

You need new material my friend. “Worst fucking nightmare?” “Barked up the wrong tree?” You’re joking, right? Here, I’1l give you one: I fucked your girlfriend so hard in the ass she cried. (beat) For more. (beat) Oh, wait, that’s been used before too, by all the guys who fucked your cock sucking whore girlfriend in the ass. The local rushes round the table toward Richard. Richard stands, slowly closes his eyes...waits for the pain...wanting it...the local clenches his fists, winds up...deep in Richard’s mind we hear him whisper...

Punish me for what I have done... BOOM...time stops.  112 113 95. Jonathan watches Richard’s head slam against the floor... it bounce...the crowd gathers...another fight in a bar wi history...on the surface no different from the rest...
Richard is passed out on the couch. There’s a knock on fr door. It becomes harder and louder. Richard’s eyes blink open.
Richard stands at the sink, quickly splashes water over h face. Runs his fingers through his hair.
Richard walks to the door with sunglasses on, opens it en to see who it is. Police Chief Boyde. Richard conjures sobriety.
Yes. Boyde looks at him through the screen.
May I have a word with you?
Richard and Boyde stand on the porch.
I heard about the fight last night.
I don’t know if you can call ita fight.
You okay? Bartender said you were hit pretty hard.
I deserved it.  This surprises her a little. She sees where some still caked around his nostrils.
Not sure if I totally believe it. The guy at the bar, it’s not the first time he’s been in a bar fight.
You don’t say.
Just do me a favor and stay clear of that place. He nods.
Yep.

I’m not raising much of a stink because your friend saved Eddie Iverson’s life. He’s a doctor, right? 96. blood is Richard nods. Ron’s cell phone rings again and again insi the house. BOYDE(CONT’D) You wanna get that?
It’s okay. Boyde asks this casually.
I have a problem I’m trying to solve. Your friend Ron told me the rental in the driveway was his. I checked it out and it belongs to Tim Arthurs. Richard tries to gloss it over.
Yeah, it’s Tim’s rental. We’re returning it for him. I don’t know why Ron would say that.
May I speak to him?  97. Beat.
Who?
Ron.
He had to go see an old friend. Left early this morning.
How'd he leave?
A taxi? I don’t know, I was sleeping. Boyde stares at Richard for a long uncomfortable time.
Mind if I looked around? Richard’s demeanor shifts from casual to worried but his sunglasses hide it.

Not a lot to do around here, huh? Tight smile from Boyde. Ron’s phone stops ringing in the house. She walks around the side of the house to the back. Richard follows closely behind her and sees Jonathan befo Boyde does. Jonathan is hurriedly cleaning the area over Tim and Ron' graves. Richard needs to distract her, fast.
Hey excuse me? She turns back to Richard, just what he wanted her to do. RICHARD (CONT’D) The old guy from the diner, how's he holding up?  114 98.
His daughter Emily said he’s doing fine. Beyond her, Richard sees Jonathan silently slip inside th house. Richard relaxes.
I’m glad to hear he’s hanging in there. She stares at him, then turns and continues toward the-
Trying to see what remnants are visible in the ashes. Jonathan has done a good job - to the naked eye, it doesn look like anything at all. The sliding glass door opens. Jonathan calls out from the
(casual) Everything okay? She turns, looks at him.
I had a question about your cars. Now she turns to Richard. They are close. We see her inhale. She smells the booze on him. She looks into his eyes a be Some uneasy feeling washes over her.

Why are you here? Stops her cold. RICHARD (CONT’D) (to Jonathan, answering for her) She has a question about the cars. (to Boyde) Right? Right? Boyde looks at Richard, conscious of her own sudden discomfort, but she holds her ground.  99.
Can I see your eyes? Richard hesitates, then slowly takes them off. Their eyes meet. His are bloodshot.
(sincere) You're very pretty, that’s for damn sure. They are inches away from each other.
Scotch, right? Richard eases off.

(to Boyde, alleviating) We're leaving tomorrow. She looks at Jonathan. Then Richard. The phone begins ringing again in the house. Boyde and Jonathan and Richard stand there, listening to none of them moving. Then Richard turns and follows Jonat into the house. Boyde turns and walks away.
Jonathan sits at the kitchen table taking inventory of th drugs.
We’re running out. He begins chopping up an odd pink pill.
What’s that?
Agenerase. An HIV-1 drug. It’s Timmy’s. Thought it would be a nice gesture. Richard sprays nasal decongestant into his nostrils.  120 121 100.

Yes. Ron’s Blackberry rings on the mantle again. Richard picks it up, sees the caller I.D. Picture - it’s Amanda, smiling. Richard looks at Jonathan, shows him the screen. Then he tosses Ron’s Blackberry onto the fire in the fireplace.
A red dot on the horizon. Growing in size. Blasting by us with a blur.
Jonathan and Richard. Red bloodshot eyes stare straight ahead.
The Porsche, parked. Unnatural light.
Frantic. Jonathan tears three prescriptions off a pad and passes them to Richard. Jonathan’s hands are shaking.
If they ask, say you’ve had a knee operation. But they won’t ask. Richard takes the prescription, gets out of the car, clos the door. Jonathan sits back, closes his eyes.

Richard walking. Bending into the hellish florescent ligh a spectre at the end of an aisle melting into the garish displays on either side of him, seeing the Pharmacy sign the back of the store come in and out of focus.
Richard whips open the door of the Porsche, gets inside, holding a Walgreens bag.  122
Jonathan wakes up - he had dozed off. Richard reaches in bag and removes a DUCK key chain. Hands it to Jonathan.
My gift to you. Press the button. Jonathan does. A sharp “quack” issues from the chip insid the duck. He smiles and looks closely at the duck.
A comment on my career path?

He’s quick ladies and gentlemen. Richard hands Jonathan the prescription bag. Jonathan feels the weight of it, looks inside, pulls out fistful of refrigerator magnets with life affirmation quo “he who limps is still walking” and “do not let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do” and “Your attit determines your altitude.” He looks at Richard, then sticks the magnets to the dash the Porsche. They sit in silence a moment looking at them A moment passes, then Richard looks at Jonathan. RICHARD (CONT’D) We should go.
You're behind the wheel. Richard, realizing he is.
Oh. Right. (beat) I'd like to see some trees.
The Porsche whistles past like a blazing red bullet.
Racing past us and disappearing around a corner...  123 124 125
123 Jonathan in passenger seat, prescription bottles on his l Jonathan looks at a prescription bottle, reads: Oxycontin

Oxycontin slows brain activity, and cuts off pain signals. Like intercepting a bill you don’t want to pay before it arrives at your house. You can see why people get addicted. One in six doctors are addicted to painkillers.

Pain. Killers. Richard stares out the window, teetering at the edge of reality. RICHARD (CONT’D) I remembered but Timmy fucking did it. He didn’t forget. He never forgot. (beat) I wanted to be the first, he stole my thunder. I wanted to be the reason. Richard trails off, then unleashes a mad SCREAM. Then he leans back, drives as he closes his eyes. slowly and calmly. RICHARD (CONT’D) There’s always the sun. Jonathan watches his friend drive blindly. RICHARD’S POV - THRU WINDSHIELD - BIXBY BRIDGE Speaks 124 Eyes wide now. The Porsche approaches the towering majest bridge.
125 Winding up toward the redwoods. The SOUND DROPS OUT and w hear footsteps, which takes us to...  126 127 128 103.

Richard and Jonathan walk, dwarfed by these ancient and majestic trees. They move in and out of shadows and light Jonathan drops pill after pill from a prescription bottle leaving a trail behind him. He feels Richard’s eyes on him, stops.
So we can find our way back. Jonathan's eyes register the scratch marks Ron left on Richard’s forearms. Jonathan turns and keeps walking.
(under his breath) Nobody wants us, Hansel. Their footsteps over the bark and twigs is all we hear.
Richard leans against a tree. He’s spinning the butter kn he used to do coke with Tim in his hand. Jonathan sits on the forest floor. He looks in Richard's eyes.

(re: the scratches on Richard’s forearms) He fought, didn’t he? Richard raises his eyes to Jonathan. A wave of feeling washes over him. An acknowledgement. An imperceptible nod JONATHAN (CONT’D) The body fights. In opposition to what the mind wants. Richard feels the tree against his back. He turns to it. stares into the bark of it. He looks at the knife in his hands, turns toward the tree...
Richard stands at the tree, with Jonathan behind him. We move CLOSER and see Richard carving the letter “T” int the trunk.

Jonathan finishes carving the letter “J” into the tree tr They've carved a T, R, R & J into it. They look at each other. There’s a long silent beat. Richard raises his hand, rests it on Jonathan’s chest.

I feel like running. Richard stares at him. It’s possible that Richard doesn’t know what Jonathan means, but then... JONATHAN (CONT’D) Run with me, Richard. (then) Can you run with me? Jonathan turns and jogs away. Richard stares after him. Richard’s eyes brighten and become child-like as he watch Jonathan running through the trees. He takes off after him. We don’t follow. We stay back until they become small...until they almost like little boys.
Richard and Jonathan are near a cliff overlooking the oce Jonathan sits on the ground, looking up at Richard, who stands closer to the cliff. Richard turns to him.

..+.-you remember in college, when Ron and Tim and you and I went to that concert flying on X? When I was cleaning out all my Mom’s stuff last year, I found the ticket stub in an old box -- it was Modern English, The Cure and XTC and some other bands. (MORE )
(beat) We were so HIGH! Remember?! We couldn't even like fucking speak. And Modern English was singing that song (sings) ...-dropped in the state of imaginary grace...
(softly singing the background vocal of the song) You should know better.

(resuming) I remember I felt these strange rays of light...and it was coming from you guys, from your eyes, and I was so fucking happy. And it wasn’t this forced happiness...it was honest, and calm...fuck man it was so pure, all these dreams that felt real, like they could happen. (can’t find the words) I lived on that image for days, it was like it was burned into my brain, like I was still high from the drug, and you guys, but it wasn’t the drugs, it was us, and I never forgot it... (long beat) I’ve never been that happy since. I’ve never even been close. Richard trails off. He turns away toward the sea. The win rises against them. Jonathan watches as Richard walks closer to the edge of t cliff. He stares at Richard’s back. Looks down at how clo Richard’s feet are to the edge of the cliff. Jonathan silently stands up. Beat. Jonathan EXPLODES toward Richard, lays a fierce tackle on at chest-height. They fly over the cliff. And disappear. We hear ocean pounding the rocks below.  130 106. We creep toward the edge and by degrees the sky fades int deeper color of blue and we are suddenly in mid-flight wi

In a CARTOON LANDSCAPE. They drop fast, feet first, towar jagged rocks below, paralysed with cartoon fear, the spee their death fall accompanied by a DOPPLERING TRAIN WHISTL But then Jonathan holds out the hem of his shirt, which h the wind-catching effect of a parachute.
Hey Richard! Look! Richard does it as well.
We can fly!!! They drift down softly, dreamily, blissed out looks on th cartoon faces. Their voices are upbeat, cheery.
This is so awesome!
Hey Rich, maybe things will turn out okay after all!
Know what Jonno? I’m gonna join a health club and clean out my body, hang out at Starbucks and rejoin society! And as they float...

I’m going come to terms with the fact that my wife shattered my heart and that I barely have a relationship with my son. Then I’m going to meet a nice girl, straighten out my medical practice and join a church!  107.
You can do it Jon! You just can! And I’m gonna sit down and write that second novel I always said I'd write!
Great! A best-seller!
Hey, it’s never too late for redemption! (beat) Maybe that’s what I’1l write about! Heck Jonno, maybe that will be the title!
“Never too late for redemption?!” I love it! Richard and Jonathan float gently toward an animated flat rock on the shore. Richard looks down.
Look, we're going to land nice and soft!
This is so incredible!
The happy ending we all wish for is going to come true! Distant high pitched whistling. Approaching fast...
Everybody loves a happy ending!
Especially after a massage! Jonathan and Richard gently touch down on the rock, huge smiles pasted on their faces... RICHARD (CONT’D) To new beginnings!
Things are going to get better after all! They raise their hands in preparation for a “high five.”  131 132 133 134 135 108.
Let’s live out our very own fairy tales! They slap five. Whistling grows LOUDER. Something from the sky. Jonathan and Richard look up. Their happy animated smiles transform to stunned dread.
(unison) Oh shit. A huge flat rock like that of a Roadrunner cartoon falls blazing speed, SQUASHES them with a HUGE BLOODY CARTOON
Jonathan leans over the cliff, wasted grin on his face. Richard turns toward him.
Let’s go home.
Night is falling in the sky behind the house.
Everything is silent. INT. HOUSE - JONATHAN’S ROOM - DUSK 134 Jonathan, shirt soaked in sweat, shaking a little, tries muster sobriety as he dials his cell.
Jane?
Hi Jonathan. I’11 get Miles.  109.
Thanks Jane. Miles comes to the phone.
Hi.
How are you, buddy?
Hi.
How is everything?
Good.
That’s good.
(suddenly excited) Daddy took me in a helicopter yesterday, because he had to meet someone for lunch. Jonathan. Crushed on the word “Daddy.” MILES (CONT’D) I was a only a little scared.
Miles. I’m your Daddy. Daniel is your stepfather.
We could see the whole city.
Do you know that? Jonathan’s eyes are welling up but he fights it back.
What?
Daniel is your step-father, Miles. I’m your father. Jane crosses through the room in the b.g., slips into a c  136 137 110.
Say goodbye Miles. We have to go.
Oh.
Promise me you won’t forget that. Okay Miles? Please.
I have to go. Mom said.

(as Miles hangs up) Okay Miles. I love you. Jonathan slumps on the edge of the bed, cell phone in his hands. He sets his cell phone on the dresser next to his stethoscope. JONATHAN (CONT’D) I love you son. He picks it up, places the earpiece into his ear canals, presses the chest-piece against his heart. There is nothing but silence.
Jonathan lies on the bed, belt wrapped tightly around his upper arm and a needle stuck in his arm. His eyes are just closing as we go to...

Slowly transforming into a projection screen for the home movie playing in his chemically altered mind. It’s a movie with Jonathan and Miles, two years earlier, beach at water’s edge in the sun. Images are dream-like. They play a game of TAG. Jonathan deftly but barely escaping Miles’ touch. They are both laughing hysterically until he slips, and Miles is sudden upon him. Miles voice sounds distant, he says the same thing over a over and the sound of it fills Jonathan with joy.  138 139 111. Instead of “I love you more than anything in the whole wi world,” Miles has his three year old’s shorthand:

I love you in the whole wide world...I love you in the whole wide world...I love you in the whole wide world. Miles and Jonathan roll in the sand at water’s edge, over by pure joy as a wave slaps the shore and washes over the And then the screen in Jonathan’s mind bleeds to BLACK.

Richard stands at the end of the hallway, staring. He walks toward us like he is trying to be utterly silent When he passes us we go to- RICHARD’S POV Walking down the hall and into INT. JONATHAN’S ROOM - DOORWAY - CONTINUOUS 139 Richard stares through bloodshot eyes at Jonathan. Jonathan is ghostly white with a syringe stuck in his arm He’s half on the bed and half off. He is not breathing. Richard turns away, rests his forehead against the door frame.
I came to tell you I cannot do this. He stays there a long moment. He walks to Jonathan, gentl lifts his feet off the floor and up onto the bed. He removes the syringe and belt from his arm.
There you go buddy. He looks at his friend and walks out of the room.  140 141 112. The SOUND OF A DIGGING SHOVEL brings us to...

Richard fills in a hole next to Tim and Ron’s graves. Sweating and breathing hard. This is the everything. The dream we see and deny, the darkness coming to all of us t lives within us, the day we all pretend will never come. Richard is the ultimate loneliness.

...each day demands we create our whole world over, disguising the constant horror in a coat of many- colored fictions; we mask our past in the green of Eden, pretend future's shining fruit can sprout from the navel of this present waste. In faith we shall board our imagined ship, and sail among sacred islands of the mad, till death shatters the fabulous stars and makes us real.

Deafening music. Richard chews a variety of pills like candy, washing them down with beer. Richard is painting. His movements are unnaturally jerky. What started as a co of the little kid Bobby’s painting, which has been ripped from its frame and taped to the wall, has grown into a hu twisted allegorical mural across the windows of the livin room. It is of himself, of his life and his end...four mounds o dirt, the end image of a man jumping over the cliff. The caption of the mural is best friends forever and ther are other smaller texts weaved into the mural: “stick to word” and “a deal’s a deal” “Ian + Sylvia" and “the last autonomous act” and “criminal & victim are the same” and this is cowardice what is courage?”
We are lost and we are liars, we fill the hole. (MORE )

Lick it, suck it, smoke it, snort it, fuck it, eat it, kill it, push it down and it’s still there. We are the stroke, the follow through. This is it. This is the everything, the beginning middle and end. Richard is deranged, he has entered a different zone of thought and space and time...
Boyde speaks with another OFFICER, (STEVENS, 50, MALE).
Well, I want to get in there, but I‘1l need a warrant.
Is it drugs?
Yes. And it’d gotten out of control. It’s not recreational now. Boyde thinks.
What if I went to Judge Bendis and said they’re dealing.
(raises eyebrows, good idea) That’11 work. Stevens nods. The phone rings. Boyde picks it up.
Police department.
INT. TIM’S LOFT/APARTMENT - KITCHEN - PORTLAND - EARLY 14

The Woman, Lisa, we saw at the beginning stands in Tim’s apartment, a cell phone pressed to her ear. She has opene the envelope that Tim left called “Lisa 2” and she’s hold a note. Lisa is in total shock.  144 145 146 114.
(voice quivering) I need to speak to the Police. About Tim Arthurs. Something he wrote.
Laura Boyde listens. By degrees we see her expression digest and go dark as sh tries to comprehend what this Lisa is telling her. Stevens watches. Boyde hangs up and bolts out of the offi
What? EXT. HIGHWAY ONE - BOYDE’S VEHICLE 145 Races past...

Richard’s bloodstream coursing with a volatile mixture of chemicals and alcohol. He is talking quietly to himself o the living room floor as he stares at his mural while listening to “Kyoko’s House” By Philip Glass full blast. He holds his knees close to his chest and rocks. His rock appears to be a way to not become ill, or stay on some li of thought in his mind, or hold back some terrible pain b born inside of him. The little boy’s painting is on the floor by his feet, as Richard’s shoes and a bottle of wine. He looks between th painting and the mural. Hard banging on the door. He turns toward it. He tries to say something but nothing comes out. The door opens. He turns, sees Boyde there. She walks in. She stops cold at the site of the mural.
Do you like it? It is like she cannot take her eyes off it. Or speak. She scans the room. Sees the drugs.  115.
(re: drugs) Have some. With the music blasting, and mural, she can FEEL the atmosphere in here, the darkness and vanished presences.

I need to know where your friends are. Richard starts putting on one of his shoes. Boyde moves t stereo, turns off the music. Pure silence for a beat. The silence has it’s own hellish feel. Boyde stares at Richar

Are you here to save me? Richard takes a large slug from the wine bottle. Holds it for Boyde. She shakes her head. Richard puts the bottle down, looks at the little boy’s painting, picks it up, holds it up to her. RICHARD (CONT’D) Can this keep me alive all by itself? Can you? You have love inside of you. I could've... (beat) I could’ve...never...never... Boyd is shocked by his state. Richard gathers himself...a little. RICHARD (CONT’D) But my friends...I loved them. But after awhile, do you even know them? When you get sucked down into your lives, you don’t. Richard stops and the world blurs. RICHARD (CONT’D) Do you feel time racing? I feel it. You’re a woman, I know you do. How would we really know if it was moving faster? Would you ? Richard closes his eyes. RICHARD (CONT’D) I’m closer...  116. He moves towards her, Richard looks at the ragged piece o paper, with his friends writing, staring at him. On the table, picks it up. RICHARD (CONT’D) (then) I loved them. I thought about them when I was weak but it only made me feel weaker because... She looks at his red eyes, bloody. RICHARD (CONT’D) ...because you can’t have the past back. No nono... and they reminded me of the past. So I rejected them...every time we were together none of us were present. Wasted. Always wasted. Richard drinks from the wine bottle. RICHARD (CONT’D) We didn’t do what we said we'd do. He tosses the bottle aside. RICHARD (CONT’D) Maybe all this... (what has happened here) ...was our way of saying we remembered what we used to feel. (beat) That means something, doesn’t it? He starts putting on his other shoe. RICHARD (CONT’D) You wanna know where my friends are? They’re dead. They’re in the back. Buried beneath the sand. When the words hit Boyde it’s like something in her defle them, or pushes them away. The unspeakable truth. She looks at him. RICHARD (CONT’D) I’m surprised you didn’t notice before. What kind of cop are you anyway? I mean you walked out there. Remember?  147 148 149 117. Boyde’s face changes...by degrees her expression grows darker... RICHARD (CONT’D) Here’s one: Jimmy Swaggart calls up Billy Graham and says, “Billy, can prostitutes be saved?” And Billy says, with religious fire in his voice, “Jimmy...every single one of us can be saved.” And Jimmy says to Billy, “good, then save me one for Saturday night.” Richard laughs to himself. Boyde looks between Richard an the back door. RICHARD (CONT’D) I’m going to make you now a light for the whole world. I swear to you that I am not lying.

Boyde steps outside. Smoldering embers on Jonathan's grav She walks toward it, tentatively. She sees charred remnants of wallets, credit cards and clothes, cash, toothbrushes, shoes over the outline of th man-sized graves. BOYDE’S FACE Undergoes lethal transformation. Disbelief. Fear. Nausea. Realization. She buckles, puts her hands on her knees, there is not en air...she rises and Boyde suddenly HEARS a MOTOR REVVING---
-Boyde bursts inside, bolts through the empty living room the front door.
Boyde sees the Porsche tearing out of driveway, runs and jumps into her squad car, races after Richard's car...  150 151 152 153 154 155 156 157 158 118.
Tail lights of the Porsche BLOW BY, HEADING TOWARDS THE OCEAN, the road looming in the distance. INT. BOYDE’S SQUAD CAR - MOVING 151 She guns her engine to keep up. Her eyes are shocked and moist...

Boyde’s squad car BLOWS BY races after Richard's Porsche. INT. RICHARD’S PORSCHE - MOVING FAST 153 Richard, dead stare, wine bottle stuck between his knees. Over his shoulder we see him approaching the hill, the sa rising epic view of his painting, the end of the world.
The Porsche enters the awe inspiring vista, the road lead to the top of the lighthouse. INT. SQUAD CAR - BOYDE’S FACE 155 Boyde sees where he is heading, the highest point of the coast.
Richard is looking out the dangerous cliff side, right outside his window, he yells in a gutteral release
We see how close to the edge and dangerously high we are going. INT. SQUAD CAR - BOYDE’S POV 158 The Porsche disappears around the winding road, up the hi  159 160 161 162 163 119.
Richard sees something up ahead...
Racing. One behind the other. Up the hill, to the top.

Richard’s eyes are wide and burning. Intense. Focused. Scared. The nose of the car climbs toward the top of the horizon line. Beyond that all there is, only the sky. Richard skids to a stop. At the edge of the cliff. We see it as he does.

head_text.subj: THE TOP OF THE COAST, THE END OF THE WORLD, EXACTLY LIKE

text: Her face ashen, as she approaches and sees Richard's car.

Boyde’s heart is racing. She gets out. Walks towards the still idling Porsche, ominously perched near the edge, a small thin fence it’s only defense to a 300 foot plunge. Boyde knows this place very well. It’s her place, her domain. Her ability to see everything from this vantage point is now turning back to her. She walks to the car door, slightly ajar and peers inside darkened window- She slowly opens it. It is empty. And looks down, on the seat, she’s a piece of small tatte piece of paper.
